Sp-L: Two new Legends! (Suzurin, Mew)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): The Shrine (Passwords and Unlocking): Special Breeds and Legendary Breeds: Sp-L: Two new Legends! (Suzurin, Mew)
By Thorr on Tuesday, January 21, 2003 - 04:48 pm:

Goldenboy and I have been diligently working to unlock the rest of the Legendary monsters. Our research has turned up a method for the Legendary Suzurin and the Legendary Mew.

Note: You can get these Legends prior to beating Emperor's Cup

Suzurin:

1) Begin raising a suzurin. Any Suzurin will work.

2) Beat the Sirius Cup (July 1, Class B, POW-Only)

3) Beat the Primary 8 (May 4, Class S, POW-only)

4) When your Suzurin has won BOTH of those POW-Only tournaments, you will receive a letter from Agima with the password "Vampire". Use it to create the Drarin (Suzurin/SP-L).

Mew:

1) Begin raising a Mew. Again, I used a Special.

2) Beat the Burning Cup (Nov 2, Class A, INT-Only)

3) Beat the Sun Cup (Aug 4, Class S, INT-Only)

4) Once your Mew has beat both of those torneys, you will receive a letter from Agima with the password "RAB?CAT?". Use this to create the Eared MEw (Mew/SP-L)

AS with other legends, once you get the first, the others will be unlocked as well.

-Thorr

Some credit goes to a Japanese website who had parts of this posted in their BBS.
Thanks to: Kurasu Sorabatu for getting them before Emperor's Cup

By GoldenBoy on Wednesday, January 22, 2003 - 03:57 am:

Just a note, on how tricky this can be.
A quick look at the tech tables for each monster will show you that Suzu only has 2 Power moves and Mew only has 2 Intelligence moves. This is intentional. Suzurin is the easier of the two because often they will start with one of the techs. If any of you have a Mew password that starts with one of the Int moves, it would be great to hear about it. Please share!

By Alai667 on Wednesday, January 22, 2003 - 10:57 pm:

Thanx for the warning on suzurins moves. This my first one and it has both of them so I won't waste money sparring. Truth be told, I like my suzurin much more than I thought I would.
